analyzed: phalika rajata hema jāla channa  vividha citra tala maddasam su ramma
translated: “Covered with a net of gold, silver, and gems,🔽I saw a delightful, variegated, beautiful floor;
I was born in the gateway of the well-made,

original: Rucakupakiṇṇamidaṁ subhaṁ vimānaṁ.🔽Bhāti ca dasa disā nabheva suriyo,
analyzed: rucaka upakiṇṇam idam subham vimāna  bhāti ca dasa disā nabhā iva suriyaḥ
translated: This beautiful mansion is filled with lovely things.🔽It shines in the ten directions like the sun in the sky,
The dispeller of darkness in autumn with a thousand rays;
So too this mansion of yours shines,

original: Jalamiva dhūmasikho nise nabhagge.🔽Musatīva nayanaṁ sateratāva,
translated: Like a flame in the sky, like a fire in the water.🔽It seems to surpass the eye, it seems to surpass the mind,
This delightful thing is placed in the sky;
With the sound of the lute, the drum, and the cymbal,

analyzed: iddham inda puram yathā tava īda
translated: This is like the city of Indra.
There are lotuses, white lotuses, blue lotuses, and red lotuses,
And there are yodhika, bandhuka, and jasmine flowers;

analyzed: sāla kusumita pupphitā asokā  vividha dumagga sugandha sevita
translated: There are asoka trees in bloom with sāla flowers,🔽And it is frequented by various fragrant trees.

analyzed: sa ḷa la la buja bhujaka sa yuttā
translated: With its six-sided pillars and its six-sided windows,

analyzed: kusaka su phullita latā avalambinī hi
translated: With its creepers in full bloom clinging to the vines;
Like a net of jewels, it is famous,
Your delightful lotus pond is well-established.

analyzed: udakaruhā ca yā itthi puppha jātā
translated: And the water-born and the land-born flowers,
And the trees that are born in the earth,
The human and the divine,

original: Sabbe tuyhaṁ nivesanamhi jātā.🔽Kissa saṁyamadamassayaṁ vipāko,🔽Kenāsi kammaphalenidhūpapannā;
analyzed: sabbe tuyham nivesanamhi jātā  kissa sayama damaḥ sayam vipākaḥ  kena asi
translated: All are born in your abode.🔽What is the result of your self-control and restraint?🔽By what deed have you attained this state?

analyzed: yathā ca te adhigatam idam vimāna
translated: How did you attain this mansion?

analyzed: tad anupadam avacā siḷāra pamhā iti
translated: Please tell us, O beautiful one.”

analyzed: yathā ca me adhigatam idam vimāna
translated: “How I attained this mansion,🔽With flocks of peacocks, cuckoos, and partridges,

analyzed: di bi api lava hasa rāja ciṇ ṇa  dija kāraṇḍava kokila abhinadita  nānā santānaka puppha rukkha vividhā
translated: With divine swans and royal geese,🔽With the sweet songs of water hens and cuckoos.🔽With various flowering trees and vines,
With trumpet flowers, rose-apple trees, and ashoka trees,

analyzed: yathā ca me adhigatam idam vimāna
translated: How I attained this mansion,
I will declare to you, listen, venerable sir.
To the east of the city of Magadha,
There is a village named Nāḷaka, venerable sir;
There I was a good wife before,
And they knew me there as Pesavatī.

analyzed: sā aham apacitattha dhamma kusala 🔽deva manuḥ sa pūjitam
translated: I, being devoted to the true Dhamma,🔽To the great one worshipped by gods and humans,
Upatissa, who was tranquil and immeasurable,
with a joyful mind I scattered flowers over him.
Having worshipped the one who had attained the highest state,
the sage who wore his last body, the noble one;
having given up my human body,
I did not return to the place I had come from in the triple heaven.”
The Seventh Mansion
